result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary M. Cooke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent. Obey all rules and regulations of the department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or any drugs. Court costs waived. Report to probation 4/14/22.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary M. Cooke

records.addlTxt: from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

2:55 PM 22CF05/22CF25/22TR137 - Defendant Zachary M. Cooke in court.  Attorney McGough appears for the City of Richland Center. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Zachary M. Cooke.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal states that they are wanting to resolve this case. Attorney McGough states the agreement to order a fine of $150 plus costs with 60 dtp, 6 month revocation, AODA/Driver Safety plan. No IID. Court orders.

Attorney McDougal informs the court of the joint agreement for 22CF05 and 22CF25. 22CF05; count 1 - amended to 961.41(3g)(b) with 30 days in the count jail but stayed for 2 years probation. Count 2 and Count 2 DRI. 22CF25; count 1 - amended to a MU severity instead of a felony with 6 month county jail stay for 2 years probation; consecutive. Count 2; will be amended to a MU severity instead of a felony with 6 months in the county jail stayed for 2 year probation, consecutive. Count 3 will be DRI.  Court grants amendment to count 1 in 22CF05 and Count 1 and 2 in 22CF25. Court finds the defendant guilty. Attorney Harper and Attorney McDougal address the court. Attorney McDougal ask for court costs to be waived. Defendant speaks to the court. 


Court orders in 22CF05; count 1-
30 days in the county jail stayed for 2 year probation, consecutive
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the department; obey all rules and regulations of the department. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or any drugs.
Court costs waived.
Report to Probation on 04/14/22
 
Court orders in 22CF25; count 1 and on count 2 -
6 month in the county jail stayed for 2 year probation, consecutive to 22CF05
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the department; obey all rules and regulations of the department. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or any drugs.
Court costs are waived.
44 days credit  on Count 2
Report to Probation on 04/14/22

22CF25- count 3 - DRI
22CF05- count 2 and 3 - DRI
Arraignment on April 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:11 PM 22CF05/22CF25 - Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by video means for Defendant Zachary M. Cooke. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary M. Cooke appeared by video means. Attorney McDougal waives the preliminary hearing based on a written offer. Court finds probable cause. Attorney McDougal would like to speak about bail and asks for a lower cash bond around $500. State objects to bond reduction in 22CF25. Court denies modification of bond.  Arraignment scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

04:08 PM 22CF25/22CF05 Defendant Zachary M. Cooke appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by video means for Defendant Zachary M. Cooke. Attorney McDougal states that the initial appearance can be completed in 20CF05 and both cases can be setover for a preliminary hearing. Max penalties stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

09:14 AM 22CF25/22CF05 - Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by video means for Defendant Zachary M. Cooke. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary M. Cooke appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Attorney McDougal waives the formal reading in 22CF25 and would like a preliminary hearing date within the time limits. Court states max penalties. Court rest for a preliminary hearing. Adjourned Initial appearance was not done for 22CF05.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cooke appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Attorney McDougal hasn't had a chance to review the complaints.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

DEFENDANT MUST KEEP THE RICHLAND COUNTY CLERK OF COURT INFORMED OF HIS ADDRESS. NEXT HEARING IS SCHEDULED TO BE HELD IN THE RICHLAND COUNTY COURTROOM. DEFENDANT HAS BEEN ORDERED TO CONTACT THE SPD FOR REPRESENTATION. IF HE HAS REPRESENTATION FOR THE NEXT APPEARANCE AND IS UNABLE TO BE PHYSICALLY PRESENT IN THE RICHLAND COUNTY COURTROOM, DEFENDANT OR HIS ATTORNEY IS ORDERED TO MAKE THE ARRANGEMENTS FOR THE DEFENDANT'S APPEARANCE.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

DEFENDANT MUST KEEP THE RICHLAND COUNTY CLERK OF COURT INFORMED OF HIS ADDRESS. NEXT HEARING IS SCHEDULED TO BE HELD IN THE RICHLAND COUNTY COURTROOM. (Defendant's copy of the notice of hearing for 6/22 at 1 p.m. was scanned with the bond sheet and emailed to the Richland County Sheriff's Department with a request that the notice of hearing be given to the Defendant)
Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:13 PM AttorneyAmy Forehand for Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachary M. Cooke appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail without counsel. Def turned himself in on this warrant; states he was in Rockford trying to get into a treatment center; presently homeless; if released today, would go to Iowa County to take care of a warrant there and then would head back to Rockford for a 12-month program. Def asks for a signature bond. State objects. Court orders 1k signature bond and set 6/22 at 1 p.m. On 6/22, Def should plan to report back to Richland County from the treatment center. Def states the facility is the Salvation Army in Rockford. Clerk questions how will make the arrangements for that appearance. Def to make those arrangements - it is on him to keep his address updated with the clerk. It is also on him to contact the SPD re representation. RCSD jail staff state that Iowa County will come to pick up the Def.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on February 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
From RCSD RE: In Custody - Richland County Jail
01:49 PM Defendant Zachary M. Cooke not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper asks for a warrant. So ordered.
No contact with Parkview Motel. Defendant must provide a physical address.

1:04 p.m. By Zoom. Defendant appeared by video from the Richland County Jail without counsel; states he has not contacted SPD; wants to take care of the matter by himself. ADA Amy Forehand appeared by video for the State. Court notes the charges - meth, bail jumping, and disorderly conduct. Def addressed the Court. Court advised the Def not to address the Court without counsel. DA Harper joined the hearing on behalf of the State; asks for $2500 signature bond and no contact with Parkview Motel; notes Def doesn't have an address and will have to provide one before he can be released. Def states he still has a mailing address on Hwy 80 south and also has a place he can go in Rockford. Court orders $2500 signature bond - no contact with Parkview Motel; must provide an address. Def asks for return date in July; says he'll be inpatient til then. Court sets initial for 1/7/22 at 1:30 and instructs the Def to contact SPD.
